name: Apparitions of Our Lady of Knock
summary: On August 21, 1879, fifteen people witnessed an apparition of the Blessed Virgin Mary, St. Joseph, and St. John the Evangelist at the gable wall of the parish church in Knock, County Mayo, Ireland. The apparition lasted for about two hours and was visible to people of all ages. Our Lady appeared in a white cloak with a golden crown, standing between St. Joseph and St. John. The apparition was approved by the Church in 1879, and Knock became one of the most important Marian shrines in Ireland, attracting millions of pilgrims.
